attributes.action: Stop bed cut's in the NHS
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
If there are less bed's it means less space available, so if a hospital's which are at full capacity are unable to keep separate MRSA patients, it means infection spread, which in turn means more death's, i wonder has any one nocticed a patteren, the more less beds are available the higher the MRSA deaths is, today i found out that 5,400 people have died in the lastest report, and according to Graham Turrner it could be 27,400.
Still think less beds mean better care, i for one think not.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
